intro: Galium capense var. expansum, commonly known as the broad-leaved bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are typically hairy and have a serrated margin. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas and along stream banks.
